intro: Antenoron filiforme var. kachinum, commonly known as the Kachin antenoron, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, thread-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
